meanings.definition: Having a sensation of dizziness or disorientation.
meanings.sent1: The room started to feel swimmy as I stood up too quickly.
meanings.sent2: She felt swimmy after spinning around in circles.
meanings.sent3: The funhouse mirrors made everything look swimmy.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts were swimmy, like trying to catch fish in a murky pond.
meanings.sent5: The heat made the air shimmer, creating a swimmy sensation around us.

meanings.definition: Characterized by a feeling of light-headedness or unsteadiness.
meanings.sent1: The swimmy feeling in her head made her sit down and take a deep breath.
meanings.sent2: The swimmy sensation passed after a few moments of rest.
meanings.sent3: The roller coaster ride left him feeling pleasantly swimmy.
meanings.sent4: The excitement of the moment made her head swimmy with joy.
meanings.sent5: The view from the top of the mountain was so breathtaking it made her feel swimmy.

meanings.definition: Causing a sense of confusion or haziness.
meanings.sent1: The swimmy instructions on the map left us lost in the city.
meanings.sent2: The swimmy details of the story made it hard to follow.
meanings.sent3: The fog made the landscape look swimmy and mysterious.
meanings.sent4: His swimmy explanation only added to our confusion.
meanings.sent5: The dream had a swimmy quality, making it hard to distinguish reality.
